div.p: ROWLEY RAGG, a genus of ſtones, belonging to the ſiliceous claſs. Ir is of a duſky or dark grey co-lour, with many ſmall Paining cryſtals, having a granular texture, and acquiring an oc'nry cruſt by expoſure to the air. The ſpecific gravity is 2748. It becomes magnetic by being heated in an open fire. In a ſtrong fire it melts without addition, but with morc difficulty than baſaltes. It was analyſed by Dr withering, who found that 100 parts of it contain 47.5 of ſihceous earth, 32.5 of argil, and 20 of iron. O
